thread.title: Ground News - Human Error Behind Nepal Plane Crash That Killed 72 Including 5 Indians: Report
thread.title_full: Ground News - Human Error Behind Nepal Plane Crash That Killed 72 Including 5 Indians: Report

author: Ground News
title: Ground News - Human Error Behind Nepal Plane Crash That Killed 72 Including 5 Indians: Report
text:
Summary by Ground News Yeti Airlines' 9N-ANC ATR-72 aircraft crashed on the bank of the Seti River between the old airport and the new airport minutes before landing on January 15. Five Indians - Abhisekh Kushwaha (25), Bishal Sharma (22), Anil Kumar Rajbhar (27) and Sonu Jaiswal (35) - were among 72 people on board when the plane crashed. Share menu More
Filters 3 Articles 3 Articles All Left Center Right
NDTV Lean Left Mixed Factuality Independent: Independent Media Individual: Gautam Adani Human Error Behind Nepal Plane Crash That Killed 72 Including 5 Indians: Report The crash of a Yeti Airlines aircraft in January this year that killed all 72 people on board, including five Indians, in Nepal's resort city of Pokhara was caused by human error, according to an inquiry report submitted to the government on Thursday. Yeti Airlines' 9N-ANC ATR-72 aircraft crashed on the bank of the Seti River between the old airport and the new airport minutes before landing on January 15. A five-member Investigation Commission …

After this accident, a five-member inquiry commission stated in its report that the Yeti Airlines aircraft crashed on January 15 due to human error.
